channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Notepad++ Update Mechanism Hijacked in 6-Month Supply Chain Attack by Chinese APT
item.description:
The maintainers of the widely-used Notepad++ text editor have disclosed a major supply chain attack that compromised their update infrastructure for six months in 2025. The attack, attributed to the Chinese espionage group Lotus Blossom (Billbug), involved hijacking update requests to selectively de...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Claims Breach of Tulsa International Airport, Leaks Data
item.description:
The Russian-affiliated Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Tulsa International Airport. The group has listed the airport on its data leak site, alleging the theft of sensitive data including financial records and employee information. While airport operations ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sophisticated Phishing Attack Uses PDF Lures and Cloud Services to Steal Dropbox Credentials
item.description:
A new, multi-stage phishing campaign is using procurement-themed emails with benign-looking PDF attachments to bypass email security filters. The attack chain redirects victims through a legitimate cloud service, Vercel Blob, before presenting a convincing fake Dropbox login page. The goal is to har...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Canada Computers Discloses Data Breach Affecting Guest Checkout Customers
item.description:
Canada Computers Inc., a major Canadian electronics retailer, has announced a data breach that exposed the personal and credit card information of customers. The incident affected individuals who used the 'guest' checkout feature on the company's website between December 29, 2025, and January 22, 20...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Play Ransomware Hits US Instrument Manufacturer Deatak in Data Breach
item.description:
The Play ransomware group has claimed another victim in the manufacturing sector, listing U.S.-based instrument maker Deatak on its data breach forum. The attackers allege they have compromised and exfiltrated a wide range of private and confidential data, including client documents, employee payrol...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: INC Ransomware Group Breaches Two U.S. Law Firms, Leaks Sensitive Client Data
item.description:
The INC ransomware group is actively targeting the U.S. legal sector, claiming responsibility for attacks on at least two law firms: Hawk Law Group and Eisenberg Lowrance Lundell Lofgren. The group alleges it has stolen highly sensitive client information, including data related to civil and crimina...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attack Cripples City of New Britain, CT, Forcing Manual Operations
item.description:
A ransomware attack has caused significant and ongoing disruption to the municipal network systems of New Britain, Connecticut. The attack, which began last week and was later confirmed as ransomware, has impacted the city's entire internet server. As a result, city departments have been forced to a...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: FCC Warns Telecoms of 4x Increase in Ransomware, Urges Better Security
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has issued a formal alert to the telecommunications industry regarding the escalating threat of ransomware. Citing data that shows a fourfold increase in attacks on the sector between 2022 and 2025, the FCC's Public Safety and Homeland Security Bureau...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Open VSX Marketplace Hit by Supply Chain Attack Spreading "GlassWorm" Malware
item.description:
On January 30, 2026, the Open VSX Registry, a popular marketplace for Visual Studio Code extensions, fell victim to a supply chain attack. Threat actors compromised the account of a legitimate developer, 'oorzc', and published malicious updates to four of their popular extensions. These updates embe...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New "Pulsar RAT" Evades Detection with In-Memory Execution and LoTL Techniques
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered a new, stealthy Remote Access Trojan (RAT) targeting Windows systems, named 'Pulsar RAT'. This modular, .NET-based malware utilizes a multi-stage infection chain that heavily relies on in-memory execution and living-off-the-land techniques to evade detection. It f...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Warning: Malicious ChatGPT Chrome Extensions Steal Session Tokens to Hijack Accounts
item.description:
Researchers have identified 16 malicious Google Chrome extensions that masquerade as helpful tools for OpenAI's ChatGPT. Once installed, these extensions inject malicious scripts into the ChatGPT web application. The scripts are designed to monitor outbound requests, intercept sensitive data such as...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: AI Social Network "Moltbook" Breach Exposes 1.5M API Keys and 29k User Emails
item.description:
A significant data breach at the AI-focused social network 'Moltbook' has exposed 1.5 million API keys, 29,000 user emails, and other sensitive data tables. The investigation, conducted by security firm Wiz, not only uncovered the data exposure but also revealed systemic security flaws, such as a la...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: FBI Shuts Down RAMP, a Notorious Ransomware Recruitment and Trading Hub
item.description:
In a significant blow to the ransomware ecosystem, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has seized the RAMP (Russian Anonymous MarketPlace) forum. The Russian-language site, which operated on both the clear and dark web, was a central hub for ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operations. It s...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Supply Chain Attack: eScan Antivirus Update Server Compromised to Distribute Malware
item.description:
Indian antivirus provider eScan, a product of MicroWorld Technologies, has suffered a supply chain attack. On January 20, 2026, a regional update server was compromised, causing it to push a malicious file named 'Reload.exe' to enterprise and consumer customers. According to security firm Morphisec,...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: New Iran-Linked 'RedKitten' Group Targets Human Rights NGOs with AI-Suspected Malware
item.description:
A new cyber-espionage campaign by a Farsi-speaking threat actor dubbed 'RedKitten' is targeting human rights NGOs and activists documenting abuses in Iran. The campaign, observed by HarfangLab in January 2026, uses phishing emails with macro-laced Excel files as an initial vector. The malware is not...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'WhisperPair' Bluetooth Flaw Exposes Millions of Headphones and Speakers to Eavesdropping
item.description:
A newly discovered vulnerability named 'WhisperPair' affects millions of Bluetooth audio devices from major brands, including Sony, JBL, and Logitech. The flaw allows a nearby attacker to bypass standard Bluetooth pairing security protocols. Successful exploitation could enable an attacker to eavesd...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: UStrive Mentoring Platform Exposes Data of 238,000 Users, Including Minors, via Leaky API
item.description:
The non-profit mentoring platform UStrive has inadvertently exposed the sensitive personal data of over 238,000 users due to a misconfigured GraphQL API endpoint. A significant portion of the exposed user base includes minors, elevating the severity and privacy implications of the incident. The leak...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Automated Attacks Wipe Exposed MongoDB Databases, Demanding $500 Ransom
item.description:
An automated data extortion campaign is actively targeting publicly exposed and misconfigured MongoDB databases. A threat actor is systematically wiping data from these unsecured servers and leaving a ransom note demanding approximately $500 in Bitcoin for its return. Research from Flare identified ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Air Conditioning Giant Blue Star Discloses Data Breach Affecting Product Installation Data
item.description:
Blue Star, a major Indian multinational specializing in air conditioning and commercial refrigeration, has announced it experienced a data security incident. The company reported unauthorized access to its product installation data. The breach was reported to its Compliance Officer on January 31, 20...

Severity: Low

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cybersecurity Risks Mount as Partial US Government Shutdown Begins
item.description:
A partial U.S. government shutdown began at midnight on January 31, 2026, after funding for several federal agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), lapsed. Security experts are warning that such shutdowns create a period of heightened cybersecurity risk for the nation. With re...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence
